entries.requirement_text: Job classifications must use official National Occupational Classification (NOC) codes maintained by Statistics Canada/ESDC
entries.notes: WiQ uses NOC 2021 codes as the authoritative source for occupational classification. dim_noc.parquet (present: True) contains the complete NOC structure ingested from Statistics Canada open data. All classifications reference official NOC unit group codes.

entries.requirement_text: NOC hierarchy levels (L1-L5) must be maintained with proper parent-child relationships
entries.notes: dim_noc maintains 5-level hierarchy: L1 (1-digit broad category), L2 (2-digit major group), L3 (3-digit minor group), L4 (4-digit unit group level 1), L5 (5-digit unit group). Foreign key relationships enforce hierarchy integrity. Each occupation traces to exactly one L5 unit group with full L1-L4 ancestry.

entries.requirement_text: Job titles must map to appropriate NOC unit groups using official example titles where available
entries.notes: WiQ uses element_example_titles (present: True) containing official NOC example titles for each unit group. The resolution service matches job titles to NOC codes using fuzzy matching against official titles with confidence scoring. Title metadata present: True

entries.requirement_text: Occupational attributes should follow NOC hierarchy for inheritance when specific values are unavailable
entries.notes: WiQ implements hierarchical attribute inheritance (module present: True). When attributes are unavailable for a specific unit group, the system walks up the NOC hierarchy (L5 -> L4 -> L3 -> L2 -> L1) to find parent values. Each imputation records inheritance depth for provenance.

entries.requirement_text: When using external classification systems (e.g., O*NET), crosswalks must map to NOC as the primary reference
entries.notes: WiQ integrates O*NET attributes through NOC-SOC crosswalk (external module present: True). The onet adapter maps SOC codes to NOC unit groups using the Brookfield/DAIS crosswalk. O*NET attributes are assigned lower confidence (0.5) than authoritative Canadian sources.

entries.requirement_text: Classification decisions must be traceable to authoritative sources with documented provenance
entries.notes: WiQ maintains 123 lineage logs documenting every data transformation. LineageGraph provides full upstream traceability to source files. LineageQueryEngine answers natural language provenance questions (e.g., 'Where does dim_noc come from?'). All classification decisions trace to NOC source data.
